name: Bahamas
description: The Bahamas, an archipelago nation in the Atlantic Ocean, is comprised of over 700 islands and cays. Known for its stunning turquoise waters, pristine beaches, and vibrant coral reefs, it’s a popular destination for tourism and offers a unique blend of natural beauty and cultural heritage. The islands boast a diverse ecosystem, ranging from lush pine forests to expansive seagrass beds, supporting a rich array of marine and terrestrial life.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city, a hub of commerce and culture.
quickFacts.detail: Nassau is located on New Providence Island and offers a mix of historical sites, modern amenities, and vibrant nightlife.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A relatively small population spread across numerous islands.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides on New Providence and Grand Bahama islands.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Spanning a vast area of the Atlantic Ocean.
quickFacts.detail: The archipelago comprises over 700 islands and cays, with only about 30 inhabited.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: Linked to the US Dollar at a 1:1 ratio.
quickFacts.detail: While the BSD is the official currency, the US Dollar is widely accepted.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The primary language spoken throughout the islands.
quickFacts.detail: Bahamian Creole is also widely spoken and reflects the islands' diverse heritage.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: The Bahamas enjoys a consistently warm and humid tropical climate year-round, influenced by the Gulf Stream. Rainfall is generally distributed throughout the year, with a slightly wetter season from June to November.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The hottest and most humid months, with average temperatures around 30-33°C (86-91°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Fall (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Increased rainfall and a higher risk of tropical storms and hurricanes. Temperatures remain warm.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The coolest and driest months, with average temperatures around 24-27°C (75-81°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A gradual transition from winter to summer, with pleasant temperatures and decreasing rainfall.

naturalWonders.name: Andros Barrier Reef
naturalWonders.description: The third-largest barrier reef in the world, stretching over 300 kilometers (190 miles) along the northern coast of Andros Island. It’s a vibrant ecosystem teeming with marine life and offers incredible diving and snorkeling opportunities.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This massive reef system protects the islands from storm surges and provides a crucial habitat for countless species. The shallow waters are particularly stunning, showcasing a kaleidoscope of coral colors.

naturalWonders.name: Exuma Cays Land and Sea Park
naturalWonders.description: A protected area encompassing over 176,000 acres (711 km²) of pristine waters and islands in the Exuma Cays. It’s a haven for marine life and a vital sanctuary for endangered species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park protects a diverse range of habitats, including seagrass beds, mangrove forests, and coral reefs. It’s a critical breeding ground for numerous marine animals, including the endangered Hawksbill turtle.

naturalWonders.name: Lucayan National Park
naturalWonders.description: Located on Grand Bahama Island, this park encompasses a diverse range of ecosystems, including mangrove forests, beaches, and a historic cave system.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park is home to the Lucayan National Forest, one of the largest mangrove forests in the Caribbean. It also features Gold Rock Beach, known for its dramatic limestone cliffs and turquoise waters.

Take a boat tour to Gold Rock Beach

biodiversityCategory.name: Marine Biodiversity
biodiversityCategory.description: The Bahamas boasts an incredibly rich marine biodiversity, largely due to its extensive coral reefs and warm, clear waters.

statistics.details: Over 60 different species of coral have been identified, contributing to the vibrant reef ecosystems.
More than 200 species of fish inhabit the waters surrounding the Bahamas, ranging from tiny reef fish to large pelagic species.
Several marine mammal species, including dolphins, whales, and manatees, are found in the Bahamas.

notableSpecies.name: Hawksbill Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A keystone species in the Bahamian ecosystem, playing a vital role in maintaining coral reef health.

notableSpecies.name: Dolphin
notableSpecies.significance: Highly intelligent and social animals, often seen interacting with humans in the Bahamas.

notableSpecies.name: Queen Conch
notableSpecies.significance: A commercially important mollusk and a symbol of the Bahamas.

ecosystemData.title: Coastal Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: The Bahamas’ coastal ecosystems are incredibly diverse and vital to the nation’s economy and environment. These ecosystems include coral reefs, mangrove forests, seagrass beds, and beaches, all of which provide essential habitat for a wide range of species and protect the islands from erosion and storm surges.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: As detailed above, the marine ecosystems are incredibly rich and diverse.

biodiversityCategories.name: Terrestrial Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: The islands also support a variety of terrestrial species, including birds, reptiles, and land crabs.

statistics.details: Over 20 species of birds, including migratory species, call the Bahamas home.

notableSpecies.name: Bahama Parrot
notableSpecies.significance: A critically endangered parrot species endemic to the Bahamas.

activities.title: Outdoor Adventures
activities.description: The Bahamas offers a wide range of outdoor activities for visitors of all interests and abilities.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters with a variety of water-based activities.

activities.name: Scuba Diving
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life.

activities.name: Snorkeling
activities.description: Discover the beauty of the underwater world without needing to dive.

activities.name: Fishing
activities.description: Cast a line and try your luck at catching local fish.

activityCategories.name: Hiking

activities.name: Lucayan National Park Trails
activities.description: Hike through the mangrove forests and explore the historic caves.
